content.rendered:
Current jobs and volunteering opportunities can be found on our vacancies page. Please note that we’re not able to provide financial support to other organisations.

Fostering Ukrainian children

Hope and Homes for Children supports the UK government’s ‘Homes for Ukraine’ initiative, however we are not able to support with matching refugees with families in the UK. If you are considering opening your home to refugees, we encourage you to register with the government led ‘Homes for Ukraine’ initiative https://homesforukraine.campaign.gov.uk/. 

Enquiries from Ukrainian refugees

Hope and Homes for Children is not involved in supporting the housing of Ukrainian refugees coming to the UK.  Please visit the UK government’s website for advice on this. https://www.gov.uk/guidance/homes-for-ukraine-scheme-frequently-asked-questions#for-those-arriving-to-the-uk

Sending goods overseas  and volunteering in the crisis zone

Hope and Homes for Children’s expertise is in providing specialist and highly skilled staff who have many years of experience in working with vulnerable children who may have been subject to trauma, neglect and abuse. We do not send volunteers or goods and materials to our programmes overseas.  There are many other local organisations sending goods so please contact them.  Our need is for funds so we can continue to support our staff in helping the most vulnerable children and families. 

You can also pledge practical support for Ukrainians arriving in the UK at https://www.sanctuaryfoundation.org.uk/ which is led by a close collaborator of Hope and Homes for Children, Krish Kandiah. The Sanctuary Foundation will share your details with Reset Communities and Refugees: https://resetuk.org/ an organisation that we believe will seek to match registrants with refugees as part of the government scheme.

For all other enquiries, please call us on +44 (0)1722 790111 or complete the form below.

Get in touch

If you would like to hear about Hope and Homes for Children’s events, fundraising and other activities by email please tick.
This field is for validation purposes and should be left unchanged.

Our head office

Hope and Homes for Children

East Clyffe,
Salisbury,
Wiltshire SP3 4LZ

For more information about our in-country teams, please go to Where We Work .

Complaints and Feedback

Home and Homes for Children is registered with the Fundraising Regulator and we are committed to achieving the highest possible standards in all of our fundraising. Our fundraising promise sets out the standards that we have adopted.

If you have a complaint about our fundraising or would like to feedback about a specific issue please write to Joe Sutton, Head of Supporter Care at the address below or email us.

If you are not satisfied with our response at the end of the process, you can contact the Fundraising Regulator and ask them to look into the matter further.

Download our fundraising promise.
Download our complaints process.

Support our work Make orphanages history

Every child deserves a proper childhood.

Donate now
